      • initLayoutWithPause

        public void initLayoutWithPause()
        Initializes a layout with the pause button, sets the LayoutManager for this LevelScreen and then adds a pause button at the desired location

        public void initImageIcons()
        Initializes the images for the background, player, and enemy objects

      • runTutorialMessage

        public void runTutorialMessage(int seconds)
        This will only run if this LevelScreen is an instance of TUTORIAL from enum Screens. It adds additional control for the Controller and displays messages at certain intervals.
        Parameters:
        seconds - - the seconds that the Controller has counted since its start, used to run messages.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints every aspect of the model that needs to be painted on the screen. Overrides the paintComponent() method from JPanel.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • refreshView

        public void refreshView()
        Calls repaint from JPanel, now extended to LevelScreen.

      • unpause

        public void unpause()
        Unpauses the Controller, and hence the current game.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the Controller, and hence the current game.

      • runDeathScenario

        public void runDeathScenario()
        Runs the code associated with in-game death, in particular it generates a random question about the content of the game.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Runs the code associated with the end-game state, in particular this is called if you run out of questions to get a new life.

      • generateRandomRangeQsRemaining

        public int generateRandomRangeQsRemaining()
        Generates a random number in the range 0 to numQs, or number of questions.
        Returns:
        - returns a random number in the range 0 to numQs

      • generateRandomQ

        public void generateRandomQ()
        Generates a random question. This method both randomizes the order in which questions are asked and the order in which the answers appear so as to not create a pattern for correct answers.

      • hasWon

        public void hasWon()
        This handles what happens when the player wins a level. It switches to the correct next level screen or to the main menu, depending on what the user chooses and which level they just won.
